meanings.sent1: After the trip, I will be repacking my suitcase to fit everything in.
meanings.sent2: She is repacking the boxes to make sure they are secure for shipping.
meanings.sent3: I always end up repacking my bag multiple times before leaving for a vacation.
meanings.sent4: The idea of repacking my belongings fills me with a sense of organization and efficiency.
meanings.sent5: Repacking can save space and keep things neat and tidy.

meanings.definition: To put into a new package
meanings.sent1: The company is repacking the products to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: They are repacking the snacks into smaller bags for individual sale.
meanings.sent3: I find repacking gifts to be a fun way to add a personal touch.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like repacking sunshine into a box.
meanings.sent5: Repacking items can make them look brand new.

meanings.sent1: The repacking of my luggage took longer than expected.
meanings.sent2: His job involves the repacking of various items for shipment.
meanings.sent3: The repacking of the picnic basket became a game of Tetris.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, repacking was a puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The repacking process can be both tedious and satisfying.
